author: erasmus
title: Conservation factory phase 1
description: Competing demands, eg. over fishing, bad agricultural practices leading to the degradation of a lake ecosystems affecting local livelihoods.

f6_assessments.q0: While this proposal has in general a noble goal, teaching communities about conservation and protecting the environment, it does not mention at all how Cardano, or even blockchain in general are helping with this purpose. While it would definitely help communities in general, it doesn't present how it would impact the Cardano ecosystem at all.
f6_assessments.q1: While the proposer states several times through the project, that people will be educated on power structure, will be educated on how to monitor environmental impact and so on, it does not describe how that education will take place. How can we as a community evaluate if people have indeed been educated, if we don't know beforehand how that process will happen, in order to measure the effectiveness of the plan? There is also no detailed description of prior experience, only a profile name called "Erasmus" and claims of having 27 years of experience in Academia.
f6_assessments.q2: While the proposal has a detailed budget, hidden in the attachment, but not present in the main text as well, it  lacks a detailed plan, roadmap, KPIs or other elements that could contribute in the assessment of the progress or success of the proposal. Since it also doesn't seem, at this point at least, to be related to the Cardano ecosystem, I would suggest a resubmission with a clearer focus on how the Cardano community would benefit and help and also include all the missing info that for now is not present.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal unfortunately is situated in the wrong Challenge. The topic brought up by the proposer can fit the 'DApps and Integration' Challenge but the proposer needs to find a blockchain developer who shares the same passion and knowledge or a partner that is already into Regenerative Farming. The key here is, 'Regenerative Farming'. Add this keyword strategically into the existing proposal, would make it to a certain extent able to be review in the 'DApps and Integration' Challenge. With that imaginary scenario in mind, this proposal in it's current state can not be reviewed on it's IMPACT for there is no data. Recommend to seek out Catalyst School, starting with their YouTube channel to learn more about the methods in preparing and submitting a proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: Again with the imaginary scenario as mentioned above, with the experience the proposer has, there is potential the proposer will be capable of implementing an education program on sustainable farming, if they were able to find a partner that is already involved in Regenerative Farming. Unfortunately, due to only providing the proposers experience and a very helicopter view of the budget, this proposal will most likely be unsuccessful. Please do reach out to Catalyst School and to study the topic on Regenerative Farming.
f6_assessments.q2: Keep in mind this assessment is based on the imaginary scenario in the IMPACT section, this proposal does not provide a roadmap but does have some metrics although it will be very difficult to measure. Problem statement and solution are actually solid. Besides that, this proposal will not be able to be audited. Situation will change when this proposer studies on and find a partner already involved in Regenerative Farming. Add to that, participating in Catalyst School workshops, this proposal has potential to be one of its kind.

But this proposal is just ideas about things that can be done to make a positive impact on the environment such as education, Create awareness on economic opportunities that are environment friendly, Empower local community members to be responsible and maintain a sustainable environment proactively,......
